text:

Jim Rowland Stadium 
KICKOFF 7 p.m. 
RECORDS Har-Ber 6-1, 4-0 7A-West. Southside 4-3, 2-2. 
ON THE AIR Watch via the free Har-Ber NIAAA app or on the Springdale Public Schools YouTube channel. 
BETWEEN THE LINES Har-Ber will open at home next year against Southside in a nonconference game. The Wildcats will also face Fort Smith Northside and Jenks, Okla., in nonconference action. ... Har-Ber has won six consecutive, including back-to-back wins over Bentonville and Fayetteville. ... Luke Hannon rushed for 318 yards and scored five touchdowns last week in Har-Ber's 47-43 victory over Fayetteville. .... Hannon had his breakout game as a sophomore against Southside when he rushed for 128 yards and two touchdowns while filling in for the injured Sain Mathew. ... Linebacker Jacob Robertson has 55 tackles to lead an improved Har-Ber defense. ... Southside beat Rogers Heritage 20-0 last week to move to 2-2 in league play. Quarterback Cooper Johnson rushed for two touchdowns... Southside is second in total offense and seventh in total defense in the 7A-West. ... Johnson is second in the league with over 1,500 yards and 14 touchdowns passing. ... Southside beat Har-Ber 35-25 last year after the Wildcats won 35-27 in 2013. 
PLAYERS TO WATCH Har-Ber -- QB Fuller Chandler (Sr., 6-2, 185), WR Trey Smith (Jr., 5-8, 155), RB Luke Hannon (Sr., 5-11, 190), WR Tyler Blackston (Sr., 6-1, 175), DE David Vowell (Sr., 6-2, 230), DB Austin Henderson (Sr., 6-2, 195), LB Jacob Robertson (5-9, 228). Fort Smith Southside -- LB Hunter Pogue (Sr., 6-1, 210), QB Cooper Johnson (Sr., 5-10, 195), WR Randy Rainwater (Sr., 6-0, 155). 
HOOTEN'S RANKINGS Har-Ber No. 1 in Class 7A. Southside is No. 6. 
HOOTEN'S LINE Har-Ber by 7 
OUR TAKE Har-Ber 42, Southside 28 
-- Rick Fires • @NWARick
